common_issues.title: Pieces macOS App UI and Feature Issues
common_issues.description: Users report UI glitches, broken features, and loading errors in the Pieces macOS app. Issues include unresponsive elements, off-screen buttons during onboarding, and blank chat windows. Solutions involve bug fixes, UI adjustments for smaller screens, and investigating potential data loading problems.

related_issues.title: [Obsidian]
related_issues.text:
[Obsidian]
### Software

Obsidian

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When resizing the right tray, two mysterious icons appear in upper left and lower right

Occurs in both Copilot and Snippets tabs

Confirmed this only happens when Pieces is active in the right tray, not when other plugins are active in the right tray.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/830457d3-4dfc-44fa-a0dc-3f50ab7ea906


Obsidian version 
1.7.7

System
```
Model Name: MacBook Pro
Model Identifier: MacBookPro18,2
Chip: Apple M1 Max
Total Number of Cores: 10 (8 performance and 2 efficiency)
Memory: 64 GB
System Firmware Version: 10151.101.3
OS Loader Version: 10151.101.3
```






## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** The user (@claire-at-pieces) reported an issue with icons appearing in the corner of the copilot.

**Key points raised:**

* User cannot see a video posted by the bot.
* User is experiencing icons appearing in the corner of the copilot.

**Problems identified:**

* User is concerned about the icons appearing in the copilot.
* User is unable to view the video for assistance.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The support bot automatically routes the issue to the relevant Pieces team member.
* The support team member (@mason-at-pieces) identifies the issue as a known feature and explains its purpose.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The user acknowledges the response and thanks the support team member.
* The issue appears to be resolved.

**Additional details:**

* The support team member provides helpful resources for future reference.
* The issue involves the Pieces software.

related_issues.title: Demo Chat are stuck loading
related_issues.text:
Demo Chat are stuck loading
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I set up a demo instance of pieces in a VM to test a bug report, for that purpose I skipped the onboarding completely, since then the demo chats are loading:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e4c5b430-b6ad-4a90-a256-b410fcae09e5)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12062024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18041156/log-12062024.txt)
PfD: [log-12062024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18041159/log-12062024.txt)

pieces are loaded and annotated correctly:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/fbba8dfd-5872-4ee4-a9e3-31a9a55f0518)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User (@hra42) reports empty chats after restarting pOS and PfD.
* User confirms chats function normally aside from being empty.
* User is using a macOS VM in Parallels on an MBP 2023.

**Problems:**

* Demo conversations are not loading correctly.
* This issue likely stems from a failure during the creation of demo conversations.

**Solutions:**

* Developer (@mack-at-pieces) plans to investigate the issue further.
* User is requested to provide additional information about the VM setup and configuration.

**Current Status:**

* The issue is under investigation.
* No solution has been implemented yet.

**Outcome:**

* The outcome is currently unknown.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user is using resources like `brew` to install and run Pieces.
* The user has reviewed similar issues for reference.

I hope this concise summary effectively captures the key points of the conversation. Please let me know if you have any other questions.

related_issues.title: Personalizing during installation broken on macOS 12.7.6
related_issues.text:
Personalizing during installation broken on macOS 12.7.6
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.2.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After installing, I get a screen to personalize my experience, but there's no way to continue after that:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1aa336e7-b02d-4b6c-8bcc-899cd4dc9679)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User (@killerog) reported an interface bug preventing them from proceeding on a small screen (11-inch MacBook Air).
* The issue appears to be due to Pieces not handling window resizing during onboarding.
* User was able to bypass the issue by tabbing and guessing the location of a hidden "next" button.

**Problems:**

* Interface element (likely a "next" button) positioned off-screen on smaller displays, blocking progress.
* Pieces does not account for window resizing during onboarding, causing layout issues on small screens.

**Solutions:**

* **Proposed:** User suggested implementing window resizing during onboarding.
* **Implemented:** Pieces developers confirmed a fix will be included in the next release, allowing window resizing during onboarding.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue marked as a duplicate of #470.
* Fix confirmed for upcoming release.
* Developers requested additional details on user's display size and resolution. 

**Additional Notes:**

* User provided a workaround using the tab key to navigate past the off-screen element. 
* Developers acknowledged the issue and thanked the user for reporting it.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and VS Code Integration Issues
common_issues.description: Users report delays, errors, and integration problems between Pieces OS and VS Code. This includes the OS getting stuck, extensions not working, and pasting delays. Troubleshooting involved updating the VS Code extension and Pieces OS, checking for conflicts, and examining log files. However, some users still face unresolved issues requiring further debugging and investigation by the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Pasting in VS Code causes delay
related_issues.text:
Pasting in VS Code causes delay
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

9.0.7

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Sometimes I notice pasting in VS Code causes a delay of around 2-5 seconds. When I disable Pieces it no longer occurs. Specifically, it is pasting anywhere within the code, not necessarily inside the chat assistant. If it happens frequently, I am forced to turn off pieces, otherwise workflow is significantly disrupted.
Error generating summary: 503 recvmsg:Connection reset by peer

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Andrea3i reported that the OS toolbar is not launching, and they tried various launch methods.
* sam-p-at-pieces suspected the issue was related to the Visual Studio plugin.
* robert-at-pieces identified the problem as an issue with the Visual Studio plugin and Pieces OS versions.

**Problems:**

* OS toolbar not launching.
* Pieces OS restarting on its own.
* New log file shows issues with applets.

**Solutions:**

* Visual Studio plugin version 3.0.1 released to resolve UI thread hang.
* Pieces OS version 10.1.15 released to change how ports are chosen for tool window integrations.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Solutions have not resolved Andrea3i's issues.
* Further debugging scheduled to identify the root cause.
* OS error code retrieval necessary for diagnosis.
* Potential problems include lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, account permission/group policy restrictions.

**Next Steps:**

* Andrea3i needs to schedule debugging time with engineers.
* Troubleshooting will involve running a utility to retrieve OS error code.
* Outcome will likely provide insights into the root cause and lead to a definitive solution.

related_issues.title: I'am sorry Something went wrong with processing. please wait a few seconds and try again or contact support@pieces.app
related_issues.text:
I'am sorry Something went wrong with processing. please wait a few seconds and try again or contact support@pieces.app
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

the ChatGpt does not work but with other Gemini works I had faced this before also after trying different solutions  I formatted my laptop by installing new windows, and it worked for 4 days after that, with the same issue please fix this issue. end semester exams are near we need ChatGPT

yes Gemini works but it sucks ChatGPT is best 

 **please fix this issue**

Thank You 
### pieces information
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e95be432-efd0-42e6-b789-2aac6b6dab35)

### The Bug/ issue
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/49aa784e-24b1-46dc-b182-a7d3484ba42b)

## Summary of GitHub Issue

**Key points raised:**

* User, Kiran-Jadhav200, is experiencing the "Something went wrong with the processing" error when using the Pieces App.
* hra42 suggests this issue might be a duplicate of #471.

**Problems identified:**

* The Pieces App is throwing an error message, preventing the user from using the app effectively.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* hra42 suggests pasting a specific URL into a browser while the PiecesOS is running to gather information about the issue.
* Mark closes the issue as a duplicate, implying that a solution for the original issue (#471) might also resolve this issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is closed, relying on the solution for the duplicate issue (#471).

**Additional notes:**

* The user did not provide any information about the specific steps taken that led to the error. 
* The user did not receive any response after sending the requested information to mark@pieces.app.

common_issues.title: Onboarding Issues in Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with the onboarding process in Pieces OS, including blank demo chats, failure to generate onboarding snippets, and 'Context Exceeded' errors. These issues seem to occur due to incomplete resets or conflicts with existing data. Solutions involve ensuring both the database and the 'com.pieces.pfd' folder are deleted during a reset and waiting for bug fixes in upcoming releases.

related_issues.title: Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
related_issues.text:
Onboarding doesn't generate pieces nor demo chats
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

15.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I reset pieces (deleting the com.pieces.os and com.pieces.pfd folder) and restart the onboarding with the following parameters:
```
 language: Go,  
 persona: Engineering Leader,  
 experience: 3-5,  
 developer Types: DB Eng, System Admin, Network Eng, DevOps, ML Eng, Back-End
```

The onboarding didn't generate any pieces nor demo chats:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/43e7a826-7635-47cd-b2fe-f2cc7ed4a676)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffb71d2f-6f6d-41c4-84a1-3d85773c3525)

The demo prompts doesn't reflect my choices either:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5d52c78b-f151-4aca-88e6-f4fc0b7fa128)

Logs:
pOS: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047726/log-12072024.txt)
PfD: [log-12072024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/18047725/log-12072024.txt)

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* User @hra42 reported an issue with the onboarding process.
* The issue involved skipping the generation of onboarding snippets and conversations.
* The user had deleted their local database but not the `com.pieces.pfd` folder.

**Problems Identified:**

* A bug was identified where deleting the local database but not the `com.pieces.pfd` folder would cause the onboarding process to skip generating snippets and conversations.
* Additionally, the user encountered a `PERMISSION_DENIED` error with the cloud services.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The user was advised to delete both the local database and the `com.pieces.pfd` folder.
* The `PERMISSION_DENIED` error was investigated and likely resolved by the Pieces team.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be resolved, but further confirmation is needed from the user.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue was identified and addressed within two days.
* The Pieces team provided helpful resources and support to the user.

related_issues.title: PFD Onboarding: Context exceeded" error on first short message
related_issues.text:
PFD Onboarding: Context exceeded" error on first short message
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

On first use of PFD v. 3.2.4 after completing the install wizard, I get a "Context exceeded" error with a short message to copilot in empty chat using (using default model `Claude Sonnet 3.5`) 

Repro 
1. fresh install of PDF on MacOS
2. complete wizard with defaults
3. in chat opened on load, ask default model Claude Sonnet 3.5 "Yo world"

May be related to #487 , but creating separate issue as it relates to onboarding

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/481c3e22-5e84-436d-b81a-4f8bfdc88083

## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key Points:**

* User (@claire-at-pieces) reported an issue.
* The issue was automatically triaged and assigned to a Pieces team member.
* User was directed to related issues and helpful resources.
* @mark-at-pieces identified the issue as a duplicate of another issue.
* The issue will be resolved in the next PiecesOS release.

**Problems Identified:**

* The user encountered an issue and needed assistance.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The issue was identified as a duplicate and marked as resolved.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is closed and will be fixed in the next PiecesOS release.

**Additional Notes:**

* The user was provided with links to related issues, documentation, and a YouTube channel.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and VS Code Extension Connection Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS failing to launch or connect with the VS Code extension. This might manifest as a stuck loading screen or error messages. Troubleshooting steps include checking for updates, examining log files, and ensuring Pieces OS is running. Solutions involve updating the VS Code extension or Pieces OS to the latest version.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS apparently stuck - VS extension not working
### Software

Pieces OS, Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.14.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi, I have just installed Pieces on my Windows 11 laptop and I'm experiencing some problems, specifically with Pieces OS and the Visual Studio extension.
Somehow, the desktop app works fine.

Pieces OS seems stuck in the system tray. Every time I click it, a "Sentry Error Event" appears in the log file and the application doesn't do anything.
At the same time, the Visual Studio extension shows a window saying that Pieces OS is not running. If I click on the launch button, a "route not found" message appears for a moment and then the "Pieces OS is not running" message comes back.

I checked for updates on the Pieces Suite app, but there are no update.

I'm attaching the log file and the response of the http://localhost:1000/applications url. I tried navigating manually to the url opened by the launch button in Visual Studio [(url)](http://localhost:1000/?application=%7B%22name%22%3A%22VISUAL_STUDIO%22%2C%22platform%22%3A%22WINDOWS%22%2C%22privacy%22%3A%22OPEN%22%2C%22capabilities%22%3A%22BLENDED%22%2C%22mechanism%22%3A%22MANUAL%22%2C%22schema%22%3A%7B%22semantic%22%3A%22MAJOR_0_MINOR_0_PATCH_1%22%2C%22migration%22%3A0%7D%2C%22id%22%3A%229ab3c1de-0625-408e-8d42-8e2c48e11d0c%22%2C%22version%22%3A%223.0.0%22%2C%22onboarded%22%3Afalse%2C%22automaticUnload%22%3Afalse%7D&capabilities=1048575&theme=%7B%22darkMode%22%3Atrue%2C%22scaffoldBackgroundColor%22%3A-14737633%2C%22primary%22%3A-328966%2C%22secondary%22%3A-14737633%2C%22onPrimary%22%3A-10724260%2C%22onSecondary%22%3A-328966%2C%22primaryContainer%22%3A-13421773%2C%22surface%22%3A-13750738%2C%22onSurface%22%3A-328966%2C%22error%22%3A-934979%2C%22onError%22%3A-1%7D) and the response is "Route not found".

Thank you in advance.

[log-11252024.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903747/log-11252024.txt)
[applications.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17903752/applications.txt)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* Andrea3i reported that the OS toolbar is not launching, and they tried various launch methods.
* sam-p-at-pieces suspected the issue was related to the Visual Studio plugin.
* robert-at-pieces identified the problem as an issue with the Visual Studio plugin and Pieces OS versions.

**Problems:**

* OS toolbar not launching.
* Pieces OS restarting on its own.
* New log file shows issues with applets.

**Solutions:**

* Visual Studio plugin version 3.0.1 released to resolve UI thread hang.
* Pieces OS version 10.1.15 released to change how ports are chosen for tool window integrations.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Solutions have not resolved Andrea3i's issues.
* Further debugging scheduled to identify the root cause.
* OS error code retrieval necessary for diagnosis.
* Potential problems include lack of IPv6 support, firewall restrictions, account permission/group policy restrictions.

**Next Steps:**

* Andrea3i needs to schedule debugging time with engineers.
* Troubleshooting will involve running a utility to retrieve OS error code.
* Outcome will likely provide insights into the root cause and lead to a definitive solution.

common_issues.title: UI glitches and unexpected behavior in Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users report various UI issues across Pieces OS integrations, including unexpected icons, line-wrapping problems, and unresponsive buttons. These issues may stem from software bugs or unintended feature interactions. Solutions involve bug fixes, UI/UX improvements, and clearer feature documentation.

related_issues.title: VSCODE Extension, Pieces Copilot line wrapping setting location or settings.json options??
related_issues.text:
VSCODE Extension, Pieces Copilot line wrapping setting location or settings.json options??
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.10

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Copilot side bar works fine but I haven't been able to find a setting to wrap lines especially in the responses code blocks.
Is there a setting for Pieces extension to wrap all text Markdown and Code Blocks??

See below, markdown text is wrapped but code block text isn't which for myself isn't ideal?
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/eec00284-7ad3-4895-9969-d66488120d76)

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**

* User johnkennyuk requested the ability to wrap code blocks within the Pieces OS terminal.
* This feature would be beneficial for creating multi-line shell scripts.

**Problems Identified:**

* Current terminal does not allow wrapping of code blocks.
* This limits functionality and readability of complex scripts.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* caleb-at-pieces confirmed the feature request is valid and will be added to the project board.
* Implementation is expected in a future release of Pieces OS.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Feature is currently under development.
* No specific release date is provided.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation only covers the initial request and confirmation. 
* No further updates or discussions are included in the provided snippet.

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When resizing the right tray, two mysterious icons appear in upper left and lower right

Occurs in both Copilot and Snippets tabs

Confirmed this only happens when Pieces is active in the right tray, not when other plugins are active in the right tray.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/830457d3-4dfc-44fa-a0dc-3f50ab7ea906


Obsidian version 
1.7.7

System
```
Model Name: MacBook Pro
Model Identifier: MacBookPro18,2
Chip: Apple M1 Max
Total Number of Cores: 10 (8 performance and 2 efficiency)
Memory: 64 GB
System Firmware Version: 10151.101.3
OS Loader Version: 10151.101.3
```






## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Issue:** The user (@claire-at-pieces) reported an issue with icons appearing in the corner of the copilot.

**Key points raised:**

* User cannot see a video posted by the bot.
* User is experiencing icons appearing in the corner of the copilot.

**Problems identified:**

* User is concerned about the icons appearing in the copilot.
* User is unable to view the video for assistance.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The support bot automatically routes the issue to the relevant Pieces team member.
* The support team member (@mason-at-pieces) identifies the issue as a known feature and explains its purpose.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The user acknowledges the response and thanks the support team member.
* The issue appears to be resolved.

**Additional details:**

* The support team member provides helpful resources for future reference.
* The issue involves the Pieces software.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving issues related to Pieces OS and VS Code integration:**  This integration point appears particularly troublesome for users. Focus development efforts on stability and performance improvements here.
**Investigate and address onboarding issues:** A smooth onboarding experience is crucial for new users. Resolve issues related to blank demo chats, snippet generation, and context errors.

**Improve UI/UX consistency and address glitches:** UI glitches detract from the user experience. Dedicate resources to thorough testing and resolution of UI-related issues across all platforms and integrations.
**Enhance documentation for troubleshooting common issues:** Provide clear and concise troubleshooting steps for common problems like connection issues, UI glitches, and onboarding errors.
**Consider developing a more robust system for handling onboarding data:**  Explore options for ensuring a clean reset of user data and preventing conflicts during onboarding.

**Gather more detailed error information:**  Implement better logging and error reporting to help developers diagnose and resolve issues more effectively, especially for issues like the 'Context Exceeded' error.

**Improve communication with users experiencing persistent issues:**  Offer more personalized support and guidance to users facing unresolved problems, such as scheduling debugging sessions with engineers.
**Analyze the root causes of frequent crashes:**  Investigate and address the underlying causes of crashes reported in tickets like #507 to prevent similar issues in the future.
**Review and update the VS Code extension documentation:**  Ensure the documentation clearly explains how to connect the extension with Pieces OS and troubleshoot common connection problems.

**Consider implementing a system for automatically detecting and resolving conflicts:**  Explore solutions that can automatically identify and resolve conflicts between Pieces OS, the VS Code extension, and other integrated applications.
